greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: successive rows have lengths 1,3,5,7,..., and are filled in across rows with the smallest nonnegative number such that there is no repeat in any row, column, or diagonal of slope +-1.
comment: Conjecture: every column or diagonal of slope +-1 is a permutation of the nonnegative numbers.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 01 2017
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 01 2017
